resources.string: I just checked into Yaniv, free for Android. Come check it out!

has won the %s achievement in Yaniv - a highly addictive card game for Android phones.
I just won the %s achievement in Yaniv - free for Android!
I just got a rating of %d in Yaniv - free for Android!
Please select a straight of 3 cards or more of the same suit or 1–4 cards of the same kind.
If you quit your existing game now %d points will be deducted from your rating. Are you sure you wish to proceed?
Please pickup from the deck as instructed.
Please pickup from the pile as instructed.
Please press the Yaniv button as instructed.
You can only drop the ONE card that you just picked up from the deck.
You can only drop the last card you picked up from the deck.
You can only pick up cards from each end of a straight.
Please select %s and pick up %s as requested.
Please select %s and then click on the deck.
This will remove all your existing achievements. Are you sure you wish to proceed?
This will reset your rating and remove your played and won statistics. Are you sure you wish to proceed?
There is no one in the database with an email of %s. Either they have not installed Yaniv, have an older version or have not added their email address. Would you like to send them an email?
%d points have been deducted from your rating. You now have a rating of %d.
%d points have been added to your rating. You now have a rating of %d.
First let\'s look at the different screen elements.
Your objective is to get your card score down to FIVE points or fewer. Joker=0; Ace=1; J,Q,K=10; other cards=face value. E.g. Your hand is worth 39 points, your opponent has 28.
You can drop multiple cards at the same time if they are the same kind or a straight of three cards or more of the same suit. You can use a Joker to replace a missing card in a straight.
In this case your highest cards are the 2 Jacks. You can swap them for a visible pile card or an unknown card from the deck.
The 7 on the pile isn\'t useful here: you don\'t have any 7\'s with which to make a pair next go and it doesn\'t help you make a straight.
Please click on both Jacks and then click on the deck to pick up a card from there.
It\'s now the computer\'s turn. The Jacks you just dropped aren\'t useful to him so he\'ll drop the two Kings and also pick up from the deck.
You could keep your 8♥ and 10♥ hoping to get a 9♥ or a Joker but that seems a remote possibility. Let\'s drop the 10♥ and pick up from the deck.
That was lucky! You\'ve picked up another 10 from the deck. You can quickly whack it down on the pile before the next player goes.
It\'s the computer\'s turn again. He could play the two 4\'s but dropping the 4, Joker and 6 is worth more points.
You can only pick up the outermost cards from a straight so you can\'t pick up the Joker. The 6 looks quite useful though because then you can drop two 6\'s next go. Drop the 8 and pick up the 6.
The computer will drop his highest card (the Queen) and pickup from the deck.
Now drop the 6\'s and pick up from the deck.
You\'ve done it! You have less than FIVE points. But first we have to wait for the other players to take their turn. The computer will drop the 5 and pick up from the deck.

Now click on the Yaniv button to call Yaniv. In this case we can see the computer\'s hand but if he had the same points or fewer than you you\'d lose the round and get a 30 point penalty. So it\'s always a bit of a gamble calling Yaniv.

That concludes the tutorial. A normal game continues until only one player remains. A player is out of the game once they reach 200 points. You\'ve now graduated from Yaniv school. I hope you enjoy playing the game.
These are your opponent\'s cards. Normally you can\'t see what he has in his hand.
This is the deck where all the remaining cards are.
This is the discard pile where players throw down cards.
And this is the compass - it points to the player whose turn it is.

Barry Irvine (henceforth referred to as \"The Developer\") is keenly aware of concerns with regards to the personal data of the individual downloading and playing the Yaniv Android game (henceforth referred to as \"The Player\") and, in order to inform players as to how personal data is used within the game and the accompanying web services, has set out the following privacy policy. All sensitive personal data passed from your device to the web services will be encrypted.

The unique IMEI of The Player\'s device is used to generate an id for use with the web services. This information is encrypted in one direction (from the device to the web service) before being stored and it should not be possible for anyone (including The Developer) to decrypt this data.

The email address provided by The Player in the settings screen is solely used to allow your friends to search for you within the online score tables. This data is encrypted in one direction (from the device to the web service) before being stored. The Developer cannot view the actual email address and, in any case, would never use your email address to send unsolicited emails or pass this information on to third parties.

The Facebook login is currently only used to write a notification to the wall of The Player when The Player opts to publish an achievement. The Player will always be given an option as to whether to post this information or not. The Developer maintains the policy of always seeking confirmation from The Player before anything is submitted to Facebook. The Facebook access token is only stored on The Player\'s device and only accessible to the Yaniv program whilst it is running.

The avatar picture stored within the settings screen is used to display the image of The Player on the various scoreboards within the game. Players are advised that the use of indecent or copyrighted images is not permitted and could result in the removal of online functionality within the game.
Your contact details are only used to populate the drop-down list on the add friend screen to assist in entering an email address.

The contents of this privacy policy are subject to change with future developments. If anything is unclear or you have further concerns regarding the privacy policy please do not hesitate to contact The Developer: yaniv.bazsoft@gmail.com

Hi,

I tried to add you as a friend in Yaniv, this great playing card game that I'm playing on my Android but I couldn't find you in the database.

Either you're on an old version (less than 1.5), you haven't entered an email address or you've entered a different email address. Can you let me know what email address you used?

If you haven't installed it yet you can find the game at https://market.android.com/details?id=com.bazsoft.yaniv.

Thanks
